description:
Boston based Bank seeks Vice President of Accounting Policy.


My client is a Top 10 bank globally. Notorious for accellerated career progression and employee retention, they boast an excellent reputation as a top employer globally. This role is at the heart of an accounting team built out of Big 4 talent and therefore, of extremely high calibre.

Description

This position is primarily responsible for providing technical accounting support to the Bank's senior management and business lines by interpreting new and existing accounting guidance as they relate to the accounting for new products, significant and/or non-routine transactions and other events. This position will also maintain and provide necessary updates to the Bank's existing accounting policies as well as help monitor any emerging accounting developments and interpret their impact to the Bank.

This position requires knowledge and proficiency with U.S. GAAP, IFRS, SEC rules and regulations, and Bank regulatory reporting. CPAs with at least seven years of relevant experience including Big 4 accounting firm experience preferred.

Main duties and responsabilities are as follows:

1. Research, analyze, and provide technical accounting guidance, interpretations and recommendations for new products, new accounting and regulatory guidance, significant and/or non-routine transactions and other events to senior management and lines of businesses, principally documented through accounting policy memorandums or technical position papers. This involves establishing and maintaining collaborative relationships with internal and external stakeholders.

2. Monitor and communicate emerging US GAAP and IFRS accounting developments (as well as regulatory guidance) and their impact to the Bank's operations, financial and regulatory reporting to senior management and lines of businesses. Work with affected businesses and lead implementation efforts. Also, assist with the Bank's representation in connection with standard setting deliberations by providing comment letters, collaborating with industry groups, etc.

3. Assist financial reporting teams by reviewing financial information, disclosures, and implementing new accounting requirements to ensure compliance with US GAAP, SEC reporting rules and regulations, and bank regulatory guidance.

4. Maintain and provide necessary updates to the Bank's existing accounting policies.

5. Assist with ad-hoc projects and initiatives as requested by senior management.

Profile

In return for an extremely competitive remuneration package, the successful candidate will possess the following:


CPA

At least 6 years of experience within a Public Practice firm

Excellent knowledge and proficiency with U.S. GAAP, IFRS, SEC rules and regulations, and Bank regulatory reporting.


Job Offer

$110,000 to $120,000 basic salary in addition to a competitive performance related bonus scheme.
title: Vice President - Accounting Policy

description:
The quantitative researcher develops an array of advanced mathematical/econometric models that capture the direction of the movement of the markets. The researcher will write programs, add functionality to existing programs, and utilize various tools to develop and evaluate trading strategies.


Job Description:

General Welfare Group/Cooperfund is a private financial research company based in the Chicago area.  We trade the markets utilizing quantitative strategies. We are interested in exceptional quantitative researchers for our trading strategy and technology development team which has multi-disciplinary representation from the physical and engineering sciences. The team typically receives interest from doctoral candidates from a wide array of disciplines, though always with a heavy computational component: applied mathematics, computer science, electrical engineering, statistics, etc.

The quantitative researchers develop, both independently and in collaboration, trading strategies in their full cycle of evolution:  from idea generation to validation and implementation.  They also develop algorithmic devices to evaluate trading ideas and strategies.



Job Qualifications:

Successful candidates must have established, proven quantitative modeling and computational skills and experience with large datasets.
Strong analytical, mathematical, and statistical proficiencies are critical to our work. Attention to detail, data accuracy, quality of output, and a firm belief in teamwork are crucial. Excellent programming skills (Matlab and C++), modeling and analytical skills are required.

Experience dealing with data is important. In addition to strong technical skills, we are looking for creative and critical problem solvers.
Experience in the financial markets is not necessary, but is helpful.

clients.  This is made possible by our people: agile minds, able to see beyond the obvious act effectively in an ever-changing global business landscape.  As you’ll discover, our culture supports this.  Diverse, international and shaped by a variety of different perspectives, we’re driven by a shared sense of purpose.  At every level agile minds are rewarded with competitive pay, support and the opportunity to excel.

Named the "Best Global Investment Bank“ in Euromoney Magazine’s annual Awards for Excellence, Deutsche Bank is a leader in Germany and Europe and is continuously growing in North America, Asia and key emerging markets.

Global Transaction Banking

Global Transaction Banking (GTB) is a world-class provider of cash management, trade finance and trust and securities services for corporations, governments and financial institutions.

At peak levels, GTB processes payments worth up to 1.4 trillion Euros per day and, as of March 31, 2012, is the number one Euro clearer and a top-six US Dollar clearer with more than 60% of overall revenues are generated from clients outside Germany.

Our People

Our people are outstanding individuals with agile minds, from a diverse range of backgrounds and cultures. They generate fresh ideas and innovative solutions which set us apart from our competitors and add value to our clients.

Represent ICSS Risk in the Americas region as the Head of ICSS Risk in the Americas

Act as the point person for all ICSS Risk issues and communicate these issues effectively to ICSS Seniors as well as the ICSS Chief Risk Officer and the rest of the ICSS Risk team.

Work closely with all our partners in the identification, prioritisation and reporting of top risks within ICSS Americas across the business lines and help drive issue resolution.

Help drive quality risk reporting in the Americas including providing a legal entity view.

Build key relationships with business heads in the Americas region and our partners and become embedded in the management organization of ICSS and the region.

Involvement in key regulatory initiatives including helping to assess their impact on the business and ensuring the business is compliant.

Help drive a forward looking view of risk in the business.




You will have:


Good understanding of the ICSS product suite and/ or strong risk management and regulatory experience preferred

Self starter and strong communicator at a senior level with excellent interpersonal skills

Ability to process complex problems, evaluate options and propose solutions

Articulate and capable of writing high quality reports and presentations

Resilient and committed with the ability to deliver within tight deadlines and under pressure.

Flexible over working hours and prepared to travel.

Determined and proactive.

description:
Quantitative Trading & Data Analyst (Trader): This role is responsible for trading and monitoring the execution of investment strategies as well as compiling and analyzing data for trade optimization.


The Millburn Corporation is a firm that provides administrative, trading and research services to an asset management firm in the alternative investment business with approximately $1.3 billion under management and more than 40 years’ experience.  The firm executes trades for the asset management firm primarily in financial and commodity futures and currency forwards using systematic trading methodologies, across a diversified portfolio of global markets.

The Millburn Corporation is seeking a Quantitative Trading & Data Analyst.  This role is responsible for trading and monitoring the execution of investment strategies as well as compiling and analyzing data for trade optimization.  This position will be a member of the Trading desk which operates in a 24x6 environment.  The Millburn Corporation executes trades for the asset management firm primarily in financial and commodity futures and currency forwards using systematic trading methodologies, across a diversified portfolio of global markets.

Nature and Scope of Responsibilities:


Execute and monitor trades

Implement and manage large data sets

Prepare post-trade analysis and present findings to senior management

Maintain working knowledge of best practices for trade execution and suggest improvements for trade strategy

Source, scrub and analyze data as needed for ad-hoc requests

Analyze, test, and develop algorithms and models to improve trade performance




Qualifications / Requirements:


One to two years trading or data/ post-trade experience (high frequency trading and automated trading experience preferred)

Knowledge of factors, conditions, and issues influencing the market

Flexibility to work shifts within a 24x6 schedule

Ability to manage a variety of tasks in a fast-paced environment

Must be personable and be able to work well at all levels within the organization

Excellent written and verbal communication skills


What we offer:

This is an exciting opportunity to help grow an established firm. We offer a culture of independent thinking, while providing many opportunities for learning and career growth.  We also offer a highly competitive salary and bonus with outstanding benefits including Medical Coverage, Health Savings Accounts, Employee Assistance Program, Life Insurance, Disability Coverage and 401(k) plan.

description:
SIG has recently hired a new Analyst in the Consumer vertical. We are looking for an associate to join his team as he launches his franchise with us.


SIG's Equity Research Department is looking for talent that wants to be a part of a ranked research platform. In order to continue the success of delivering a differentiated research product, we are looking for an Equity Research Associate to provide research support for the Food & Beverage sector in our New York office. The role will be mentored by a well known Sr. Analyst. Under the guidance of the Senior Analyst, the Research Associate will perform most of the major functions of a research analyst, including analysis of individual company financial statements, market research, product and competitive positioning.

The Equity Research Associate’s role calls for significant primary market research of the Food & Beverage industry. The ideal candidate will conduct data collection, statistical studies and interaction with management and trade associations. The Associate will perform financial and valuation analyses by generating financial models and forecasts and will create competitive profiles on specific companies. The job offers excellent exposure to emerging growth companies in the consumer sector and provides a strong career path in sell-side Equity research, asset management, and business development/corporate strategy.

In this role, you will:


Provide primary analytical support for the Senior Analyst covering the  space

Conduct proprietary research, customer/partner interviews and industry surveys

Perform financial and valuation analysis by generating financial models/forecasts and competitive profiles on companies under coverage

Gather and analyze data from a variety of sources, including, but not limited to, company documents and materials, SEC/regulatory filings (annual reports, 10-K’s 10-Q’s, etc.), industry publications, trade shows, and online data services

Interact with company management, internal sales force, and institutional investors

Monitor and evaluate company news and events

Perform other related duties, as assigned


Qualifications:


Bachelors degree in quantitative area such as finance, economics, engineering or mathematics desired; CFA or MBA preferred

1-2 years of financial analysis experience in either the finance, accounting, or consumer sectors

Series 7, 63, 86 and/or 87 a plus

Excellent research, writing, communication, and organization skills; candidates must be very detail oriented

Working knowledge of Microsoft products (Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint and Word)

Independent thinker and self-starter with the motivation to learn about and excel in a dynamic industry
title: Equity Research Associate, Consumer

description:
Susquehanna Growth Equity (SGE) is a private equity fund focused on late stage venture, growth capital and growth buyout opportunities in the United States, Europe, and Israel. We are currently looking for an Analyst to join our team.


The firm is focused on software, internet, information services, and technology enabled businesses.  SGE has invested in 26 companies since its founding in 2006, and currently manages over $500 million in assets.  The firm is backed by the Susquehanna International Group (SIG), a large privately-held financial services company.  To learn more about SGE’s investment approach, team, and portfolio, visit www.sgep.com.

As an analyst or associate, you will be a full member of the investment team, working closely with our senior deal professionals at every stage of the investment process.  You will quickly gain valuable experience as you develop financial models, network with industry entrepreneurs, and evaluate potential investments in new industries.   This position represents a unique opportunity for highly-motivated professionals to assume a wide set of responsibilities and make a significant impact in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.   Our team is located in Bala Cynwyd, Pennsylvania, just outside of Center City Philadelphia.

Specific Job Duties


Deal sourcing, deal execution, and on-going portfolio management

Assisting in due diligence for potential new investments, including market research and analysis of industry trends, financial modeling, and valuation

Analyzing operational forecasts and budgets for active and potential investments

Developing presentation materials for the firm and its portfolio companies

Tracking industry statistics and maintaining quarterly and semi-annual internal databases


Qualifications:


Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree

Superior work ethic, strong desire to learn, and uncompromising attention to detail

Excellent analytical, research, and organizational skills

Outstanding written and oral communication skills

Outgoing personality and willingness to aggressively market the firm through outbound calling programs, networking, and thesis-based company targeting

Proficiency in Microsoft Office, especially Excel and PowerPoint

While an academic background in a quantitative or computer science field is preferred, we encourage those who have distinguished themselves in any challenging course of study to apply.

Applicants with up to three years of experience at an investment bank, consulting firm, or software company should consider applying.

description:
The Program Finance Analyst (PFA) is responsible for the administration of program funds including financial set-up, payments, monitoring and reporting.


The Program Finance Analyst (PFA) is responsible for the administration of program funds including financial set-up, payments, monitoring and reporting.  The PFA will support the Senior Program Finance Manager with analysis, grant/contract management, budgeting and reporting.  The PFA will play a crucial role in ensuring efficient and accurate financial reporting and adherence to contract compliance.  Work is performed independently under general supervision.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
include the following.  IIE may add, change, or remove essential and other duties at any time.






Budgeting
: (i) Develop expenditure forecasts for programmatic activities, grantees, vendors, contractors and sub-recipients (ii) Support the development of cost proposals and cost narratives for new business

Financial Deliverables
: (i) Prepare financial deliverables, reports and invoices for submission to sponsor (ii) Monitor collection of required supporting documentation (iii) Track valuation and reporting of cost share as applicable

Financial Accounting:
(i) Set up new project codes, grantee IDs, new vendors and sub-recipients for payment (ii) Pay grantees, vendors and sub-recipients via check, wire or EFT in compliance with their grant’s/contract’s terms and conditions (iii) Issue and monitor debit cards as applicable (iv) Work with Controllers to resolve payable/receivable issues as needed (vi) Monitor checks and wire receipts from sponsor, credits and refunds from vendors, contributions, donations and other cash receipts

Analysis:
(i) Review and analyze program expenses against budget, explain variances (ii) Review travel expense reports, credit card reconciliations, cash advance requests for allowability, allocability and reasonableness (iii) Support program staff, management and sponsor with ad hoc financial analyses (iv) Review tax, SEVIS, travel and insurance charges to the program, make corrections as necessary and submit journal entries for cost transfers

Grant/Contract Management:
(i) Comply with applicable contract and sponsor requirements, OMB Circulars, FAR if applicable, and follow all IIE policies and procedures (ii) Raise potential compliance issues; serve as a compliance resource for program teams (iii) Work with Grants & Contracts and Legal teams to review vendor and sub-recipient agreements and amendments (iv) Ensure that all awards and deliverables are on IIE’s Award Management System (iv) Perform close-out of awards and sub-awards

Training:
(i) Train program staff on IIE’s financial policies and procedures, how to use IIE’s financial systems (SAP, IIE Reports, Concur, AMS, Enterprise, Peoplesoft in the future) and explain best practices  (ii) Document and assist with development of financial processes and workflows for the program team (iii) Participate in IIE-wide initiatives and provide feedback to working groups as needed














Job Requirements

Education/Experience:


Bachelor’s Degree required; business, accounting, economics, finance or related field preferred.

At least two years of financial management experience required; preferably in a non-profit setting.

Financial management experience with the federal government a plus.

Experience with educational institutions and international programs a plus.




Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:


Knowledge of finance and accounting policies, procedures and administrative practices.

Excellent knowledge of Excel required.

Knowledge of federal rules and regulations including OMB-A110, OMB-A122, and OMB-A133 required.

Excellent interpersonal communication skills, both oral and written, including the ability to read and interpret documents such as policy and procedure manuals, and write clear, concise instructions, routing reports and correspondence.

Experience in projects and tasks involving complex details which require well-developed organizational, time-management and administrative skills.  Ability to multi-task and prioritize competing projects with limited resources.

Ability to exercise discretion on confidential matters.

Knowledge of Microsoft Office 2010, database and internet software.




Work Environment and Physical Demands:

Essential functions are typically performed in an office setting with a low level of noise.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

description:
Domain:Banking


Title                     : Quantitative Analyst

Duration           : 6+ Months
Location            : San Francisco, CA


Job Requirements:

This position is responsible for developing, maintaining and validating risk models for quantifying various types of financial risks (such as operation risk, credit risk, market risk and interest rate risk) inherent in the Corporation's business activities and processes. These models calculate values at risk or economic capitals that are reported to Senior Management and the Board of Directors on a regular basis as a key input to risk management decision making. Models must use methodologies that are theoretically sound, with modeling choices, assumptions and parameters that are justifiable and supportable. The incumbent ensures that model development, implementation, data input, reporting, documentation, validation and maintenance use best practices, adhere to consistency and quality standards, and follow the guidance of corporate policies and procedures and regulatory requirements.

The candidate must have:-


A superb quantitative and analytical background with a solid theoretical foundation coupled with strong programming, documentation and communications skills.

Must have a Bachelor’s or Master's Degree/PhD preferred (e.g., mathematics, physics, statistics or engineering) *

Minimum three - five years’ experience in applying and managing use of statistical risk management models - such as Credit Metrics, Credit Risk + or KMV experience in numerical analysis and computational methods using programming languages (such as C/C++, C#, Java, MATLAB, SAS, R) and mathematical/statistical software packages.

Must be extremely focused, detail oriented, results oriented and highly productive.

Must have the ability to efficiently and effectively conduct independent research, analyze problems, formulate and implement solutions, and produce quality results on time.

The candidate must have excellent technical documentation and presentation skills, assertiveness & influencing skills, and the skills to explain abstract theoretical concepts to a non-expert audience in easy-to-understand language.

description:
Security Risk and Compliance Specialist (based in NY or CA)


The Security Risk and Compliance Specialist will support the Information Security risk management process within the Company. The primary responsibilities of the position are to assess the adequacy of security and business continuity/disaster recovery controls of First Republic's vendors and recommend mitigating controls. In addition, the position will be responsible for compliance reviews against information technology policy and procedures, tracking of remediation items, security risk reporting and tracking, and Information Technology audit preparation and response.

The ideal candidate will be a self-starter and have an inquisitive, analytical mind that constantly looks for solutions to difficult problems. The Specialist must have the ability to convey technology and security concepts to management and ideally has technical knowledge and/or experience in security with a proficiency in a risk management framework with the ability to assess administrative and technical controls.

The Security Risk and Compliance Specialist will possess excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to understand business requirements. To succeed in this position, they must be able to develop risk management strategies that align with business goals and protect the confidentiality, integrity and availability of information systems and our data.

A successful candidate must be driven and goal-oriented with the ability to complete tasks with limited supervision within an evolving and entrepreneurial environment. The Security and Risk Compliance Specialist will work with other departments throughout the Bank and must be detail-oriented to successfully manage multiple projects at the same time.

RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:


Continuously review the security and business continuity controls of Bank's vendor based solutions for compliance with Policy and Procedures.

Identify and communicate recommended security and business continuity controls and control deficiencies to business units. Document and monitor the implementation of controls for technology and business project plans.

Review vendor contracts for compliance with Bank security, business continuity and disaster recovery requirements and recommend appropriate language as necessary.

Maintain broad knowledge of best practices and trends in the field of IT Controls, Information Security and Business Continuity.

Perform duties & responsibilities specific to department functions & activities.

Performs other duties & responsibilities as required or assigned by supervisor.

Responsibilities include the following: 1) adhering to and complying with all applicable, federal and state laws, regulations and guidance, including those related to Anti-Money Laundering (i.e. Bank Secrecy Act, USA PATRIOT Act, etc.), 2) adhering to Bank policies and procedures, 3) completing required training, 4) identifying and reporting potential suspicious activity to the BSA/AML Officer, and 5) knowing and verifying the identity of any customer(s) that enters into a relationship with the Bank.


Critical features of this job are described under the items above. They may be subject to change at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons. This job description reflects management’s assignment of essential functions; it does not prescribe or restrict the tasks that may be assigned. Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.


Requirements


KEY SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:


Minimum 4 year college degree required.

Relevant information security certifications (e.g., CISSP, CISA, CISM, CRISC, or GIAC) preferred or the ability to gain a certification within 6 months of hire.

3 years of information security, information technology, IT controls assessment or technology risk management related work experience.

Strong communication & organizational skills, ability to multi-task, strong attention to details, excellent problem solving and follow-up skills required.

Work independently; make decisions and multi-task effectively in a very diverse, project oriented environment.

Ability to complete high quality deliverables.

Team player

Provides extraordinary service

Furthers the First Republic Bank culture and values


MENTAL/PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:


The ability to learn and comprehend basic instructions; understand the meanings of words and respond effectively; and perform basic arithmetic accurately and quickly.

Vision must be sufficient to read data reports, manuals and computer screens.

Hearing must be sufficient to understand a conversation at a normal volume, including telephone calls and in person.

Speech must be coherent to clearly convey or exchange information, including the giving and receiving of assignments and/or directions.

Position involves sitting most of the time, but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time.

Must be able to travel as position requires.

May be required to lift 25-50lbs.


Position is and can be based in either New York (NY) or San Francisco (CA)

A Passion to Perform.


It’s what drives us. More than a claim, this describes the way we do business.  We compete to be the leading global provider of financial services, balancing passion with precision to deliver superior solutions for our clients. This is made possible by our people: agile minds, ability to see beyond the obvious, and act effectively in an ever-changing global business landscape.  As you’ll discover, our culture supports this. Diverse, international and shaped by a variety of different perspectives, we’re driven by a shared sense of purpose. At every level agile minds are rewarded with competitive pay, support and the opportunity to excel.

The
Credit Execution Team
(CET), part of Capital Markets & Treasury Solutions North America (CMTS NA), is responsible for the processing and troubleshooting of loan and loan commitment requests from Deutsche Bank's (DB) client base.

This role on the CET is responsible for the Loan Screening Memo (LSM), the main document used to process a request. The LSM is primarily prepared by the CET, but with assistance from the Client Service Team (CST) which is headed by the Senior Client Executive (SCE). This requires the Analyst to work with various members of the CST and be able to prioritize tasks accordingly. The LSM contains a variety of information which describes the request, information on the company, the business relationship and opportunity, and financial metrics on historic and forward returns (i.e. Return on Risk-Weighted Assets, Return on CRD4 Exposure). The LSM is used to present the merits of the request to the Loan Screening Committee (LSC) which votes to approve or decline the request.

This role on the CET is also responsible for troubleshooting potential issues which make occur before, during, and after the LSC meets to hear the request. Such situations may include issues with Credit Risk Management (CRM), Legal, and Finance. This task also requires the Analyst to work with colleagues sometimes under time sensitive conditions.

This role on the CET will be responsible for credit commitments primarily in the Natural Resources sector and will work with an existing senior level CET colleague to ensure the entire portfolio is covered. Fluency in presentation skills including Microsoft Word, Powerpoint, and Excel is strongly preferred.

Requirements:


Bachelors Degree required

Highly motivated with a strong willingness to learn and take on new challenges

Be extremely diligent, efficient and able to manage multiple conflicting deliverables including working under pressure

Strong communication skills (written and verbal) with strict attention to detail

Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint

description:
Market Risk Management Analyst The Market Risk Management Analyst is responsible for daily assessments of the various risk exposures of CME's clearing firms, analyzing how those exposures could impact the Clearing House, and generating reports to CME Clearing House senior management. This person continually analyzes


Market Risk Management Analyst

The Market Risk Management Analyst is responsible for daily assessments of the various risk exposures of CME's clearing firms, analyzing how those exposures could impact the Clearing House, and generating reports to CME Clearing House senior management. This person continually analyzes the CME financial safeguards to ensure that performance bonds, security deposits, internal clearing firm thresholds, and other protections are adequate. The role has significant interactions with the Financial, Operations, and Systems Development departments in the Clearing House. The Market Risk Analyst needs to be able to gain proficiency in SPAN margining and other risk algorithms and assists in evaluating better ways to margin new products across many different asset classes.

In addition to intraday and end of day market risk analysis, this role will be expected to work on projects across functional groups in order to continuously improve Clearing House Risk Management systems. This role requires a good understanding of the futures markets in general with a background in the agricultural commodity markets. The candidate needs a good understanding of common market risk methodologies such as VaR, SPAN, stress testing, liquidity risk, and concentration risk. This position also requires a good amount of direct customer interaction. This role requires the ability to work both independently and collectively with several divisions across CME to deliver high quality results for high priority and time sensitive projects. Projects often require independent thinking and taking initiative to fully define the problem and recommend solutions.

Qualifications:

BA or BS in a business/financial field

MBA or Master’s degree preferred

1-2 years’ experience involved in a market risk management

Must possess demonstrated quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills

Ability to work flexibly in a team environment

Expertise in Microsoft Office, particularly in Excel

Must possess strong oral and written communication skills and be able to articulate complex concepts to senior management on a regular basis

description:
The Alfa Fellowship Program is a high-level professional development initiative placing up to 18 American, British, and German citizens per year in work assignments at leading organizations in Russia in the fields of business, economics, journalism, law, public policy, and related areas.


Job type
:
Fellow

Location:
Moscow, Russia

Program Description
:
The Alfa Fellowship Program begins with language training in the Fellow’s geographic location followed by a language course in Moscow starting in mid-June. Throughout the summer, Alfa Fellows attend a seminar program with key public and private sector officials to discuss current issues facing Russia. Fellows then work at prominent organizations in Russia, including private companies, media outlets, think tanks, and foundations.

Eligible candidates must have a graduate degree and professional experience in business, economics, journalism, law, public policy, or a related field. Russian language proficiency is not required, but is preferred. The Fellowship includes a generous monthly stipend, language training, program-related travel costs, housing and insurance.

Key goals of the Alfa Fellowship Program are expanding networks of American, British, and German professionals, developing greater intercultural understanding, and advancing knowledge of Russian affairs in the West.

Eligibility Requirements
:
- U.S., U.K., or German citizen between the ages of 25 and 35
- Graduate degree and professional experience in business, economics, journalism, law, government or public policy. Candidates without a graduate degree must demonstrate extensive and equivalent professional experience in their field.

Desired Qualifications:
- Outstanding professional achievement and academic qualifications
- Active involvement in community or public service
- Evidence of leadership potential
- Russian language experience is preferred, however not required, at the time of application. Applicants proficient in another second language may be considered.

Application Information:
The application deadline for the 2016-2017 program year is December 1, 2015. To access the online application, please visit: http://www.alfafellowship.org/application-process.

For more information about the Alfa Fellowship Program or application process please contact:

Cultural Vistas
Alfa Fellowship Program
440 Park Avenue South, 2nd Floor
New York, NY 10016
Tel. (212) 497-3510
Fax. (212) 497-3587
Email. alfa@culturalvistas.org
Web. www.alfafellowship.org

OJSC Alfa-Bank is incorporated, focused and based in Russia, and is not affiliated with U.S.-based Alfa Insurance.

A global leader in financial information services is currently seeking an Account Manager to join their team in San Francisco.


The primary purpose of your role is to support the sales Director in the San Francisco office. You will collaborate closely with the Sales Director to drive sales productivity, meet sales and customer management objectives across global Financial Institutions.


The team’s overall goal is to develop and maintain new relationships and grow existing accounts.  You will be responsible for selling a suite of products and services within the firm that includes:


Research and ratings data services

Data and services for credit derivatives and market-implied ratings

Valuation, workflow and analytical tools for structured finance transactions and CDOs

Fundamental financial data for financial institutions and corporations

Pricing and valuations services


Job Description

Responsibilities will include but not limited to:


To support the Sales Director with the renewal process, sales administration (contracts and CRM)
To achieve your non-sales KPIs (which will be set by your Regional Head of Sales)

Achieve annual net sales target

Maintain a high level of business activity - evidenced through tracking in our CRM, which includes frequency of client/prospect meetings, new proposals and other activities.

Losses and Cancellations: minimize potential losses and cancellations.

For all cancellations a post-mortem assessment will be conducted to assess the reasons why it was cancelled, as well as what could have been done differently.

Build and maintain a strong deal pipeline.

**Please note that this role will require regular travel.


Job Skills


At least three years’ experience in a similar account management and sales role is required in order to successfully fulfill this position.

Fixed Income / Capital Markets experience preferred

Pro-active and assertive

Motivated to achieve sales results through price negotiations and cross selling activities

Building lasting relationships, and adding value

Articulating value propositions and solutions rather than just product feature / benefits and pricing discussions

Strong relationship management skills and experience in nurturing and growing a territory Expertise with renewal negotiation

Works well in a team environment - leveraging internal stakeholders / other departments (Client Service, product etc) to drive customer engagement and sales

High degree of social skills / relationship management and influencing

Comfortable influencing on telephone and face to face

description:

They are looking for a Senior Java Developer with experience in building high-performance, scalable, enterprise-grade applications. You will be part of a talented software team that works on mission-critical applications. You will be responsible for Java development while providing expertise in the full software development lifecycle, from concept and design to testing.

Responsibilities


Design and develop high-volume, low-latency applications for mission-critical systems, delivering high-availability and performance.

Thorough knowledge of relational Database concepts and practice.

Write well designed, testable, efficient code.

Interaction with a variety of 3rd party systems and apis.

Prepare and produce releases of software components across multiple environments and release cycles

Support continuous improvement by investigating alternatives and technologies and presenting these for architectural review.

Skilled in Linux/Unix commands for manipulating, evaluating and analyzing massive datasets


Requirements


BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related subject

5+ years of hands-one Software Development experience

5+ years of experience in Java development

Javascript and HTML 4.0-5.0 experience very helpful.

Profound insight of Java and JDK internals (Classloading, Memory Management, Transaction management etc)

Excellent knowledge of Relational Databases, SQL and ORM technologies (JPA2, Hibernate)

description:

Our Client provides hedge funds and asset managers with data-driven consolidated reporting solutions that deliver quantifiable results into prime brokerage financing. Firm assists multi-prime managers with a suite of intuitive tools that keeps client data secure, makes it possible to substantially improve day-to-day fund performance, minimize risks, and unearth valuable insights that would otherwise remain hidden. In this role you will help with pre sales analysis, onboarding, and continued support.

Requirements


The role requires the candidate to demonstrate effective communication and collaborate with different client audiences and other areas of GBM operations to achieve optimal operational capacity.

Strong understanding of Prime Brokerage Operations processing globally

Documentation of plans, models, concepts and processes

Be able to solve complex problems across a broad range of disciplines (functional as well as project-orientated)

Utilize specific business or management knowledge that can be clearly brought to bear in improving what and how Production and Change can be improved

High level Client Relationship Management

title: Client Associate

description:
Our Client is one of the leading providers of financial analytics technology. They are specifically looking for a candidate passionate about combining financial analytics with technology and with a keen interest in math and quantitative finance.




Responsibilties

As part of the Client Services team, the Solutions Developer will help design and develop business solutions for customers based on the firm’s award winning platform for valuation and risk measurement of financial derivatives. You will play a key role in establishing credibility and confidence with prospective customers and partners by leveraging your technical expertise to drive the vision through its thought leadership, product solutions, and services. You will be very hands-on in the development of solutions but will also contribute as a subject matter expert in the design of applications.

Specifically, this role will be expected to:


Provide solution development and financial engineering expertise in the pre-sales process to prospective customers and partners through customer sales presentations, product demonstrations, webinar facilitation, and discovery workshops.

Understanding customer requirements for application development using the firm’s technologies, including taking account of their enterprise IT environment.

Participate in Proof of Concept (POC) and Professional Services engagements to develop and implement their solutions.

Effectively understand and analyze customer business requirements and assist with proposal development.

Develop and implement solution deliverables in timely and efficient manner either independently or as part of larger project implementations.

Work with Service Partners where they are assisting customers in such work.

Work very collaboratively with Sales, Client Services, Product Management and R&D to champion solutions for customer business needs and resolve critical customer issues.

Travel (an estimate of 25%) to customer locations and/or other office locations to deliver services


Requirements


Advanced degree (Bachelors or Masters) in a technical discipline (i.e. computer science, software engineering, physics).

2 - 5 years’ experience with hands-on software development, ideally in the financial services industry.

Strong object oriented programming skills and hands on development experience with technologies such as C#/.Net, Java, Python, C++ and other API related technologies.

Strong understanding of core computer science concepts including multi-threading, memory management, system performance, managed language concepts (e.g. Garbage Collection) and non-managed language concepts (e.g. memory leak, pointers, etc.).

Strong understanding/interest in math and quantitative finance.

Keen interest to learn by working with a variety of customer specific contexts and an ability to manage deliverables across multiple projects.

Outstanding communication skills with an ability to convey complex information to a range of audiences.

Ability to work well under pressure, meet deadlines, and thrive in a fast-paced, intellectually challenging, and performance-driven environment.

Detail oriented with good project planning and organizational abilities.

description:
FORT is looking for software engineers with cross-functional skills. The role requires understanding and documenting FORT's existing software applications and subsequently taking ownership of developing and rewriting automated trading tools and applications.


FORT is a premier hedge fund in the managed futures space and has provided alternative investment advisory services for over twenty years to institutional investors and high-net-worth individuals.  The firm utilizes fully automated systematic trading strategies and keeps technology at the core of its operations. It has offices located in Chevy Chase, MD and New York, NY. The firm currently operates 3 fully systematic, automated trading programs and has approximately $1.5 billion in assets under management.

FORT is in the middle of an exciting and substantial growth period.  It is currently one of the top 20 managers by assets worldwide in the CTA/Managed Futures field according to CTA Intelligence, an industry publication.  The firm’s strategies have been recognized by numerous industry groups and publications and the firm was recently awarded the “CTA Management Firm of the Year” award at the 2015 CTA Intelligence U.S. Performance Awards.

Based upon their experience managing investment teams, the founders strive to create an open environment within the firm to both support and encourage continuing education for their employees.  With technology being integral to all firm processes, technology professionals at FORT have a natural pathway to interact with other departments, allowing for cross-training and a substantial increase in their knowledge base of both the firm and the hedge fund industry.

Roles/ Responsibilities


Understand existing trading and back office software systems and business processes. Create detailed functional specs by interacting with stakeholders and using the applications. Create technical and functional spec for each application by interacting with the relevant engineer.

Create test plans for applications. Set up document version control or wiki for functional specs, technical specs and test plans. Executing test plans and reporting the results.

Take ownership of software applications, making code changes and enhancements as needed. This will include maintaining and updating a large code-base; updating and rewriting applications and tools; testing and deployment; managing database; systematically organizing and managing data, settings and logs.


Required Education & Experience:


BS/MS Degree in Computer Science or related field required.

3-7 years of experience in system design, documentation, software and database development and testing.

3-7 years of experience programming in writing multi-threaded applications, agile development and software automation.


Technical skills
:


Proficiency in one or more programming languages - C# / Python / .Net / VB.NET / VB6.0 / Java / SQL Server

Hands-on experience with Scripting languages like Perl

Knowledge of equities/futures trading is desirable but not mandatory.

Experience with S&P Capital IQ Compustat database is a big plus.


FORT offers a highly competitive salary, with benefits, and an attractive bonus plan.

title: Derivative Modeler

description:
This position will play a key role in developing and implementing the Model Risk Management program across the firm. The Director is responsible for all aspects of the model risk management function including governance, validations, leading the Model Risk Management Committee and interfacing with auditors/regulators.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Set the strategic direction for Model Risk Management at the firm.
Lead a team and collaborate with other areas on a variety of model types – including those used to manage credit risk and market risk – as well as those used by financial reporting and various product areas.
Coordinate model validation across multiple business units including broker-dealer, investment banking, retail banking, private equity, etc.  Facilitate validation activities as needed.
Conduct and/or lead model validations across a diverse universe of models firm – wide.
Consult with business leaders to develop and implement statistical solutions and models (scoring models and valuation models) to address and influence complex business problems that maximize business value as needed.
Represent firm wide model risk management program to regulators, management and board of directors.
Ensure defend-ability of modeling results by providing effective challenge and independent oversight and review.
Ensuring consistency of standards, appropriate level of rigor, and timeliness of model validation and remediation activities
Balancing the tension between assumptions and model credibility while educating stakeholders on model assumptions, effectiveness and limitations to facilitate use of output to inform decision making
Evaluation of existing model governance programs for effectiveness and for consistency with regulatory expectations and industry leading practices
Influence positive change through leadership, sound statistical and quantitative analysis and demonstrated subject matter expertise.
Provide thought leadership and knowledge of industry leading practices.
Translate quantitative concepts into layman’s terms.
Performs human resource management activities, including identifying performance problems and approving recommendations for remedial action; evaluating performance; and interviewing and selecting staff.
Plans, assigns, monitors, reviews, evaluates and leads the work of assigned staff.
Coaches and mentors staff and identifies training needs and creates development plans.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Knowledge of:
Mathematical finance, statistics, econometrics, financial economics, and actuarial mathematics.
Banking, finance, and securities industry operations from the perspective of banks as well as broker/dealers.
Financial markets, with advanced understanding of fixed income derivatives and structured mortgage products.
Valuation of complex positions and instruments, and statistical techniques.
Federal Reserve’s model risk management guidance SR 11-07.


Skill in:
Implementing advanced risk theories and concepts in workable models.
Critical thinking, problem solving, and creativity.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Strong presentation skills.


Ability to:
Explain quantitative concepts to a non-quantitative audience
Ability to manage, coordinate and facilitate multiple initiatives in a fast paced and dynamic environment.
Conduct statistical analysis to evaluate risk, incorporating both frequentist and Bayesian methods.
Ability to influence and guide across departmental boundaries.
Analyze, organize, and prioritize multiple tasks and meet deadlines.
Interpret, analyze, and apply technical information.
Stay abreast of industry best practices, procedures, and techniques.
Provide technical advice and training.
Remain adaptable and resilient while working in a sometimes high-stress environment.
Attention to detail while maintaining a big picture orientation.
Work independently as well as collaboratively within a team environment.
Establish and maintain effective working relationships at all levels of the organization


Educational/Previous Experience Requirements:
Master's degree in Mathematics, Statistical modeling, Computational Finance, Economics or related field and a minimum of 7 (seven) years of Model Risk Management experience, preferably in the financial services industry.
~or~
An equivalent combination of education, training or experience


Licenses/Certifications:
None Required.
title: Director, Model Risk Management

description:
See job description.


At Duff & Phelps, we stand for the qualities that power sound decisions. And we believe that behind every good decision, you'll find solid thinking, proven experience and valuable insight. But all the numbers and facts in the world mean nothing without a top team of professionals to make sense of them all.

That's where
YOU
come in - provided you're incisive, entrepreneurial and up for a challenge. We offer an environment where your talent and perspective matter - where you can make a real impact.

Join our team and together we'll power the sound decisions that enhance value - yours and ours.

Vice Presidents work on a variety of assignments, including business enterprise valuations, purchase price allocations, valuations of complex securities including financial assets and liabilities as well as capital structures, intellectual property valuations, stock option valuations, and dispute consulting.

Responsibilities:


Building client relationships and acting as a direct contact with current and prospective clients in the financial services sector and in and around the Chicago/Midwest/Mountain geographic area

Interviewing clients, including face-to-face meetings, to gather data and information pertinent to the engagement with a general knowledge of some aspect of the financial services industry sector (banking, insurance, asset management, financial technology, etc.)

Providing insight and expertise on target industries, market, and competitor information focusing on the financial services sector

Managing valuation analyses, including understanding relevant Accounting Standards Codifications (“ASC”), including ASC 350, 718, 805, and 820, and relevant tax standards as they related to particular valuation needs (i.e. IRC 409(a), 83(b), etc); determining appropriate valuation methodologies; and building and reviewing financial models build by junior staff.

Identifying and communicating potential engagements to executive management

Working with executive management to resolve financial services industry technical issues and to promote valuation best practices

Supervising and mentoring staff on analyses, reports, presentations, and their overall careers with Duff & Phelps


Requirements:


Work out of our Chicago office with a willingness to travel to other Duff & Phelps, client, and prospective client sites

Bachelor's or Master's degree, with further experience and/or qualifications in Finance and/or Accounting, MBA from an accredited college/university, or additional professional accreditation such as CFA , ASA, or CPA

Minimum of 5 years of experience at an Accounting Firm or Consulting Firm specializing in the valuation of businesses; intangible assets; financial assets and liabilities; and capital instruments of regulated financial services institutions (i.e. banks, insurance companies, asset managers, etc.), with experience in constructing and reviewing valuation models and other financial and statistical models including: DCF, comparable company and transaction, stock options, etc.

Demonstrated leadership experience including managing and developing client relationships and mentoring and developing staff

Strong analytical and problem solving skills, as well as strong verbal and written communication skills

Knowledge of software packages including MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint


Duff & Phelps is committed to providing equal opportunities in employment. We will not discriminate between applications for reason of gender, gender identity, race, religion, color, nationality, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, age or disability.

Powering Sound Decisions.

description:
Bosch Fellows work as consultants in their field of expertise at leading public or private institutions in Germany. Fellows receive intensive language training and participate in professional seminars, where they travel to exchange ideas with key figures across Germany and Europe.


-  High-level work experience in German institutions including the federal government, private corporations, print and broadcast media, law firms and NGOs.

- Travel, seminars and networking events throughout Europe -- fellows meet with key decision-makers in the public and private sectors, gaining an in-depth understanding of current issues facing the European Union and Germany

- EUR 3,000 monthly stipend and compensation package including health insurance and coverage of transatlantic and program-related travel costs; additional funding is available for families

- Intensive German language training provided as needed in US and Germany. No German language skills required at time of application.

- Professional networking opportunities with over 530 Robert Bosch Fellowship Alumni.



QUALIFICATIONS:

Candidates for the Robert Bosch Foundation Fellowship Program must meet the following requirements:


U.S. citizen

40 years of age or younger at the application deadline

Minimum five years of relevant, full-time work experience in target fellowship field (excluding internships)

Graduate degree preferred

Evidence of outstanding professional performance

Sincere commitment to furthering the transatlantic relationship




APPLICATION INFO:



The application deadline is November 1, 2015.  For further information and to access the online application, please visit our website:
www.culturalvistas.org/bosch
.

Completed online application including:


Short essay questions

Resume

Most recent university transcript

2 letters of recommendation.  Recommenders should be recent supervisors or professional mentors who have worked closely with the applicant.

description:
See job description for details


THE COMPANY
Tracing our roots to 1928, Wellington Management is one of the world's largest independent investment management firms. With US$939 billion in assets under management as of 31 March 2015, we serve as a trusted adviser to institutional clients and mutual fund sponsors in over 50 countries. Our innovative investment solutions are built on the strength of proprietary, independent research and span nearly all segments of the global capital markets, including equity, fixed income, multi-asset, and alternative strategies. As a private partnership whose sole business is investment management, our long-term views and interests are aligned with those of our clients. We are committed to attracting a talented and diverse workforce, and to fostering an open, collaborative culture of inclusivity because we believe multiple perspectives lead to more informed investment and business decisions. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we welcome people with diverse life experiences, fresh ideas, and specialized subject-matter expertise.

THE POSITION
The Fixed Income Derivative Strategist will provide leadership in implementing derivative-based strategies across appropriate fixed income teams. The role also includes managing assets in sleeves across a diverse array of products and serving as an advisor and subject matter expert to others using derivative strategies to produce alpha or mitigate risk.

This role requires highly developed skills in fixed income derivative instruments, expertise in derivative-based strategies, strong communication skills, and a solid foundation in investments. The successful candidate is a flexible problem solver with a can-do attitude who takes ownership and is willing to make investment decisions. The individual will work closely with the Global Derivatives Group, the Fixed Income Group, and other functional areas.

RESPONSIBILITIES
•Propose and analyze different derivative strategies to best instantiate investment ideas within specific portfolios
•Identify and communicate derivative based investment ideas to generate alpha and/or mitigate risk as they arise opportunistically
•Educate and strategize with colleagues, clients and consultants on the derivative markets and how they might be used for potential client solutions
•Develop close working relationships with a variety of fixed income investment teams
•Help train individual team contributors on beneficial ways to use derivatives to assist in alpha generation and risk mitigation for their respective teams

QUALIFICATIONS
Five plus years of investment experience in institutional fixed income derivative markets. Experience at an investment management organization is ideal; experience in institutional investing is a significant plus.

•Creativity, attention to detail and leadership skills
•Strong fixed income background: derivative experience required and investment experience preferred
•Excellent quantitative and problem solving skills, ability to perform rapid analysis, potentially under significant time constraints
•Strong investment judgment
•Flexibility: ability to work independently and in a team environment
•Willingness to develop knowledge of non-traditional instruments and new complex strategies
•Excellent interpersonal communication skills
•Advanced degree and/or CFA are a plus

description:
A Passion to Perform.


It’s what drives us. More than a claim, this describes the way we do business.  We compete to be the leading global provider of financial services, balancing passion with precision to deliver superior solutions for our clients. This is made possible by our people: agile minds, ability to see beyond the obvious, and act effectively in an ever-changing global business landscape.  As you’ll discover, our culture supports this. Diverse, international and shaped by a variety of different perspectives, we’re driven by a shared sense of purpose. At every level agile minds are rewarded with competitive pay, support and the opportunity to excel.

Risk
In an ever-changing financial landscape, the role of the Risk division has never been more important. A strong risk management culture helps to reinforce Deutsche Bank’s resilience. The function identifies aggregates, manages and mitigates risk across the core activities of market risk management, operational risk management and credit risk management, supporting the bank’s strategies whilst protecting its capital and regulatory adherence.

Our People
Our people are outstanding individuals with agile minds, from a diverse range of backgrounds and cultures. They generate fresh ideas and innovative solutions which set us apart from our competitors and add value to our clients.

Role Description
Deutsche Bank has challenging and rewarding opportunities within its Market Risk Comprehensive Capital Analysis and Review (CCAR) team. Compliance with the aforementioned is to allow the Federal Reserve Board to evaluate the potential effects of adverse economic and financial market conditions on Bank Holding Company (BHC) capital and therefore measure the ability of the BHC to absorb losses.

The program includes, among other things, the establishment of an Intermediate Holding Company (IHC) and corresponding infrastructure for calculating the components of the Global Market Shocks (GMS) which includes: 1) Trading MTM Loss, 2) CVA loss, 3) Largest Counterparty Default Loss, and 4) Issuer Default Loss.  Additionally, projection of market risk RWAs is required.

The director level positions will be accountable for the successful completion of all stress testing activities, meeting the constantly increasing expectations of both regulators and the business users of outputs. The candidate will help lead MRM CCAR functions with responsibility for the day-to-day execution, program management and co-ordination with senior stakeholders across various areas. The key focus will be on influencing and leveraging the broader organization across the Risk, Finance and Technology functions to deliver against tight timelines. To this end responsibilities will include those listed below (dependent on position).


Responsibilities include:
• Oversee the implementation, calculation and validation of MRM CCAR GMS components.
• Create effective solutions to the strategic MRM CCAR process and actively drive the strategic implementation forward.
• Lead the development of the fundamental building blocks and inputs/outputs required of the future-state GMS/RWA calculations and systems.
• Drive improvements in risk capture and reporting, working cross-functionally across Market Risk, Finance and IT to obtain/derive results.
• Assist in establishing CCAR production process and consistently improve effectiveness of controls.
• Provide accurate and timely analysis in support of management decision making.
• Lead pro forma and pilot work streams and achieve successful results.


Experience & Skills:
• 8+ years of experience with Market Risk Management modeling, statistical analyses, or stress testing and scenario analysis.
• A strong ability to define stress testing best practices across multiple assets classes, products, and businesses.
• Project / program management experience obtained in either a Risk function or Finance.
• Strong background in CCAR stress testing and Validation, Economic Capital, and VaR analysis.
• Solid understanding of basic risk concepts (the Greeks, Value-at-Risk, stress loss, PD, LGD, EAD).
• Solid knowledge of IRC, CRM, CVA, PFE, EE and EPE is preferable.
• Excellent understanding of stress testing activities and end-to-end processes.
• Experience with statistical tools and risk management tools.
• Advanced leadership and communication skills.
• Ability to operate effectively at executive level, influence and mobilize the broad support
• Must be able to understand and translate complex CCAR regulatory, technical and business needs in order to effectively scope and direct priorities for successful Regulatory Approval.

Education/Certification:
• Degree from an accredited college or university with a concentration in Business, Finance, Economics, Engineering, or the Hard Sciences is preferable.
• CFA/FRM/PRM certified is preferable.
title: Market Risk Comprehensive Capital Analysis and Review (CCAR) – Director

description:
Deutsche Bank A Passion to Perform. It’s what drives us. More than a claim, this describes the way we do business. We compete to be the leading global provider of financial services, balancing passion with precision to deliver superior solutions for our


clients.  This is made possible by our people: agile minds, able to see beyond the obvious act effectively in an ever-changing global business landscape.  As you’ll discover, our culture supports this.  Diverse, international and shaped by a variety of different perspectives, we’re driven by a shared sense of purpose.  At every level agile minds are rewarded with competitive pay, support and the opportunity to excel.

Named the "Best Global Investment Bank“ in Euromoney Magazine’s annual Awards for Excellence, Deutsche Bank is a leader in Germany and Europe and is continuously growing in North America, Asia and key emerging markets.

Risk

In an ever-changing financial landscape, the role of the Risk division has never been more important. A strong risk management culture helps to reinforce Deutsche Bank’s resilience. The function identifies, aggregates, manages and mitigates risk across the core activities of market risk management, operational risk management and credit risk management, supporting the bank’s strategies whilst protecting its capital and regulatory adherence.

The Market Risk Methodology team within Market Risk Management is responsible for the development of DB’s capital models for market risk, including the Value-at-Risk (VaR), Stressed Value-at-Risk, Comprehensive Risk Measure and Economic Capital methodology. Those risk metrics are used both for internal purposes to estimate and control market risk as well as for external purpose since they feed measures such as Risk Weighted Assets – Pillar 1 and Risk Bearing Capacity – Pillar 2.

The Market Risk Methodology team is based in London, Berlin and New York.

Our People

Our people are outstanding individuals with agile minds, from a diverse range of backgrounds and cultures. They generate fresh ideas and innovative solutions which set us apart from our competitors and add value to our clients.

Role Description

The ‘Enhanced Prudential Standards for Foreign Banking Organisations’ will require, in mid 2016, the formation of an ‘Intermediate Holding Company’. This new holding company will be required to participate in the Federal Reserve Board’s ‘Comprehensive Capital Analysis and Review’ (CCAR).

To ensure successful participation, Market Risk Management is required to establish and develop methodologies, processes, reports and documentation in a range of activities including but not limited to: Market Risk RWA Projections, Trading Mark to Market stress tests and CVA calculations.

The successful applicant will contribute to the initiatives and developments related to Market Risk RWA projections. In more detail, this includes


providing quantitative and qualitative justifications for modelling choices, assumptions made, data selection, reliability of model inputs including risk sensitivities and market data

validating model choices by theoretical proof and support them with empirical evidence (e.g. statistical analysis of historical market data)

identifying model limitations and quantifying impact of parameter uncertainty

constructing market data time series when data is unavailable, including investigating filling algorithms to cope with missing/inadequate market data

keeping abreast of the latest development in external regulations, rules, and supervisory guidance for market risk models, and be responsible to keep both those models as well as development processes in full compliance to these requirements

developing best in class market risk methodologies with supporting analysis, performing adequate testing to ensure correct implementation

seeking independent model review and approval before releasing changes into Production

regularly reassessing the effectiveness of current methodologies and the integrity of both the market data as well as other static parameters used to cover both recent and/or stressed historical windows

producing comprehensive documentation of new or amended market risk methodologies


The successful candidate will take ownership of individual methodology development items from upfront analysis phase and model description to functional specifications and UAT. During the front-to-back development, various stakeholders will have to be involved:


Agree approach with and get acceptance from the Market Risk Managers

Ensure industry best-practice by rigorous challenge process within governance framework to satisfy the expectations of Regulators

Check feasibility of implementation approach with Information Technology and Operations


Other assignments include


Preparing supporting material for Senior Management Committees, both Internal Workshops as well External Workshops/Audit with Regulators

Training of junior colleagues and throughout Market Risk Management




Qualifications & Skills


You will have a graduate and/or post graduate degree in quantitative finance, mathematics, physics, engineering or a similar field of study

Strong quantitative skills including a good mastery of Probability, Statistics and Derivative Pricing Theory

A good understanding of regulations pertaining to the Americas, especially CCAR advantageous.

Solid experience in using large datasets and applying market data methodologies across different product/asset classes

Familiarity with databases, including SQL and SAS

Good knowledge of financial products and financial markets

Good knowledge of risk management (VaR, backtesting of VaR, regulatory requirements)

Experience of working in Matlab and SQL

Programming experience in C, C++, Java, Java script, web services is a plus

Experience in building linear / non linear regression based time series models

Ability to take ownership of issues/modules and deliver against challenging timelines

Strongly self-motivated, structured approach and a strong analytical ability paired with a strong attention to details

Proven ability to multi-task different projects and prioritize whilst ensuring high quality and consistency in your work

Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English

Reliable team player with the motivation to work in a dynamic, international and diverse environment

Commitment and motivation for self development and growth




At Deutsche Bank, we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action (M/F/D/V) employer.

description:
A Passion to Perform.


It’s what drives us. More than a claim, this describes the way we do business.  We compete to be the leading global provider of financial services, balancing passion with precision to deliver superior solutions for our clients. This is made possible by our people: agile minds, ability to see beyond the obvious, and act effectively in an ever-changing global business landscape.  As you’ll discover, our culture supports this. Diverse, international and shaped by a variety of different perspectives, we’re driven by a shared sense of purpose. At every level agile minds are rewarded with competitive pay, support and the opportunity to excel.

Background

Living Wills is the global regulatory response to protect the global economy and financial system from the potential default of global, systemically important financial institutions such as Deutsche Bank (DB).  As a result, DB considers Living Wills to be one of the most topical and strategically important regulatory requirements. Living Wills focuses on establishing both recovery and resolution plans for DB as well as ensuring that DB has the appropriate processes in place so that a crisis at DB would not impact the greater financial system. The resolution plan aims to ensure the orderly resolution of DB, if its recovery plan fails, and keep its critical businesses going.

To support the Living Wills recovery and resolution plans,
Organisational Development Unit
(ODU) will be leading the creation of a Service Catalogue for services consumed by the various US Businesses. This will require understanding the Fed expectations of this deliverable and then executing on that to satisfy the Fed requirements. Creating the Service Catalogue inter alia requires developing a service taxonomy, mapping resources and costs to services and legal entities to ultimately estimate costs per service. This requires working with all the Infrastructure COOs in the US to agree the service taxonomy and help with mapping the current teams and costs to the services. Finally depending on the solution (dependency with Jade), implementation in terms of either restructuring UBR or moving employees into separate legal entities might be required.

In order to deliver DB’s U.S. key project initiatives, a dedicated role is now required to lead the project on a daily basis, supported by external consultants and in close cooperation with the US Living Wills team, Infrastructure COOs in the US and the ODU Process team. The ideal candidate possesses proven project management skills on complex projects. This is an opportunity to gain exposure across DB’s businesses, products and operations.

Key Responsibilities:


Overall project management

Manage risks, issues and project status for project

Develop and produce senior management presentations

Disseminate information and guidance on regulatory developments that could impact the project initiatives.

Oversee project management reporting (e.g. status, risks, missed milestones and issues, budget)

Coordinate updates to senior committees, regulators, and senior management as necessary.


Requirements:


Able to lead a team of internal and external employees and check activities against promises/commitments

A strong project manager with a minimum of 6-8 years experience managing complex projects

Proven track record for managing risks, issues and project plans

A strong ability to develop effective relationships and engage senior stakeholders

Ability to understand cross program risks and issues and provide leverage to assist stakeholders in resolving them

An appetite to work in areas outside previous expertise or comfort zone and an ability to quickly adapt to new regulatory guidance and requirements

Ability to engage and coordinate senior stakeholders towards an agreed objective and timeline

Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint skills

Rigorous and meticulous in the production of senior management and regulatory deliverables

Proficient in English, both spoken and written.

Driven to succeed with a focus on driving progress against timelines

Capability to work in a dynamic environment

DB experience desirable

Good team player, knows how to build his/her own network


Preferred:


Project management qualification

Consultancy experience

US Regional Market Risk - Vice President (CCAR)

Client and Opportunity Overview

Our client, a global corporate and investment banking organization, is seeking a Vice President (VP) level market risk professional with hands-on experience managing and explaining CCAR-related stress and shock-testing results. They're seeking 6+ years of market risk experience, an advanced degree, and a CFA/FRM.

Main Function of the Job


Work with Market Risk Director to manage regional Market Risk Appetite process

Work with US (Chief Risk Officer) CRO, US Holding Company (USHC) BoD and US Executive Committee to determine top-down Regional Market Risk Appetite based upon business and financial goals

Work with business-aligned Risk Managers and regional business management to determine bottom-up Market Risk Appetite requirements

Work with business-aligned Risk Managers to allocate Market Risk Appetite at the business level

Work with business-aligned Risk Managers and Risk infrastructure to build and execute MIS to monitor and report Market Risk Appetite usage across key stakeholders

Assist with implementation of Regional Key Mark Risk Control Framework

Work with Global Key Risk Officer to customize Global Key Risk Control Framework for regional implementation

Work with business-aligned Risk Managers and Risk infrastructure to implement Key Risk Control Framework regionally, including business allocation of regional limits

Work with business-aligned risk managers and Risk infrastructure to build and execute MIS to monitor and report key risk usage and controls indicators

Manage regional escalation process for Key Risk Control Framework

Assist with implementation of Regional Market Risk Limit Framework

Work with business-aligned risk managers to determine more granular level of key limits to control regional business level risk taking

Develop aggregate regional risk limits as necessary

Work with business-aligned Risk Managers and Risk infrastructure to build and execute MIS to monitor risk limits and report usage across key stakeholders

Manage regional escalation process for key regional limits

Attend Regional Risk Committee meetings

Work with business-aligned Risk Managers and Risk infrastructure to develop and execute MIS to track aggregate and business level risk usage across all businesses in the region

Work across risk management to drive analysis of regional risks, searching for concentrations and/or exposure to current, potential or emerging business conditions

Review, evaluate and challenge the aggregate and business level risk profile

Review controls indicators to ensure effectiveness of Key Risk Control Framework

Provide input and escalation into Executive and Non-Executive US Risk Committee


Main Duties and Responsibilities


Work with the IHC Market Risk Portfolio Director on helping establish CCAR capability and helping execute the CCAR program, including:

Capability definition and project progress tracking
