description:
About Northern Trust and FlexShares As of June 30, 2014 Northern Trust had $915 billion assets under management across private and institutional clients worldwide.


Job Description:

Manages a full set of major fee revenue producing investment accounts, generally for institutional and non-profit investors.

Operates within the framework of the underlying client’s investment policy statement and Northern trust’s Investment Policy guidelines, developing strategies designed to achieve specific investor goals. Functions as a senior staff member and technical expert in the peer review and/or investment management process. Assignments involve a high level of client servicing, often as the primary client contact.

Knowledge/Skills:

Knowledge of investment and portfolio management theory, accounting and financial principles, associated investment strategies and instruments, and characteristics of various marketplaces, usually acquired through formal education and work experience, is required to manage portfolios. Knowledge of investment terminology, the laws and regulations governing trust investments and taxation, as well as the bank's investment policies, procedures and strategies, usually acquired through work experience and formal education, is required to operate within the framework of governing documents. Decision making, sales, and negotiating skills are required to guide sensitive or difficult situations through to agreement.

Major Duties:

1. Manages investment activities for a full set of major fee revenue producing accounts, representing institutional and non-profit accounts.

2. Manages accounts that often require complex decision making or special handling (e.g. nature of relationship, size/type of assets managed, sensitive client issues, coordinating shared authority with outside attorneys/consultants).

3. Develops, recommends, and directs the execution of programs designed to achieve investment objectives for accounts or entity relationships. Reviews and analyzes investments to select assets and manage individual portfolios.

4. Ascertains the purpose or intentions of the trust/agency agreement/investment policy statement and the level of investment authority granted to the trustee/agent.

5. Analyzes and plans the overall investment strategy of the trust/agency account, develops investment policy in conjunction with client representatives, participates in continuous revision of account objectives in the context of client needs.

6. Maintains extensive contact with administrative relationship managers, clients, co-fiduciaries, consultants, the bank's legal area and outside attorneys to ensure communication of trust/agency/investment policy requirements and coordinate portfolio activity.

7. Maintains a current awareness of new investment strategies and instruments through regular contact with the investment research area and other industry professionals, as well as through personal research.

8. Functions as senior staff member and/or technical expert on a peer review team providing regular review of portfolio activities, and in the investment management process.

9. Participates in the development of new revenue generating business and the expansion of existing client relationships, and the pursuit of opportunities with their board members and related parties, which can be both institutional and personal prospects.

10. Ensures the completion of processing needs relative to the administration of assigned accounts.

11. Performs financial analysis on specific individual assets as needed.

12. Serves on standing investment services committees and on ad hoc unit committees as appropriate.

Experience :

Minimum 12+ years of investment experience, which may include research, in which consistent long term investment performance has met objectives. CFA preferred.

description:
An institutional equity asset management firm is currently looking to hire an Asian Equity Analyst with 7 - 10+ years of Asian Equity research experience within the asset management industry. Experience with small and mid-caps (aside from large-caps) is required.


Position Summary

The Asian Equity Analyst will be responsible for researching and analyzing Asian companies and generating investment ideas from both developed and developing markets in the region. The analyst will be a generalist, covering multiple sectors and industries, with a bias towards smaller companies with market capitalization not exceeding $5 billion. The candidate should be willing to work within the framework of the current global / international equity strategies, which are based on a free cash flow methodology that blends fundamental and quantitative insights.

Responsibilities

The Asian Equity Analyst is expected to perform the following duties as well as other tasks that are customarily part of the buy-side equity research function.

• Research, analyze, and recommend investment ideas for inclusion in Non US strategies. While the primary focus will be the firm’s international small cap fund (i.e. ISC strategy), the analyst is also expected to contribute ideas, as appropriate, to the firm’s other global and international strategies including Global All Cap, Global Choice, and EAFE.


• Generate and research investment candidates relevant to the thematic emphasis represented in the strategy based on the analyst’s experience and expertise. The analyst is also expected to research investment candidates as directed by the portfolio manager and/or generated by the firm’s quantitative and screening processes.


• Contribute to the firm’s broader research efforts by actively participating in investment research meetings, sharing knowledge, and collaborating with colleagues as necessary.


• Contribute to and participate in marketing and client service activities including presentations, meetings, and calls with clients, prospects, and consultants.



Requirements


7 – 10+ years of experience as an Analyst on the buy-side
with a strong, fundamental research background. Specifically, candidates should have:

•
Demonstrated track record of success in investing in Asian markets
utilizing a methodology similar to that of the firm, i.e. free cash flow metrics rather than accounting terminology.


• A highly developed skill set in developing a view on a company as a result of detailed financial modeling as well as industry and company research.


• Ability and desire to operate as a generalist, with the possibility to become more focused over time. Specific sector experience that is viewed as desirable includes consumer related stocks, Industrials, Utilities, energy and technology.


• An ability to combine a macro / global understanding with fundamental stock-picking that has led to positive performance over market cycles.


• Self-starter with the capacity to function with minimal supervision while providing appropriate and meaningful feedback to portfolio managers.


• Consummate team player who will contribute across the firm’s strategies in a collegial and collaborative investment culture.


• Strong verbal and written presentation skills.


• Strong leadership skills evidenced by example and possessing the potential to assume additional responsibilities over time.


• Highly motivated to be successful and help build a firm of substance where clients are the priority.


• Intellectual curiosity and a passion for the investment industry.


• Bachelor’s degree required (MBA and/or CFA are preferable).

description:
Seeking Implementation Managers in the US, UK and France to lead our global system implementation.


~~Company Overview
*Awarded Best Buy-Side Performance Measurement and Attribution Product 2013, 2012, 2011, 2010, 2009, 2008 by Waters Technology
*Awarded “Best in Class” for User Experience, Workflow Management and Enterprise Support, 2013, by Independent Research Group

BI-SAM is a leading provider of performance, attribution, risk, data management, composites and reporting solutions for financial services companies in EMEA, APAC and the Americas. Many of the world’s largest and most innovative asset managers, wealth managers, asset servicers and asset owners leverage BI-SAM’s award-winning B-One solution to streamline operations, enhanced client service, increase operational efficiencies and improve accuracy.

Created in 2000 by experts in asset management, technology and strategy consulting, BI-SAM has become a market reference for performance & risk measurement and attribution, data management, GIPS compliancy and reporting solutions.

BI-SAM’s award winning* B-One® platform offers customers maximum scalability, while reducing the overall cost of supporting growth in fund/portfolio volumes, establishes a recognized source of master data for producing time series performance returns and reports, and delivers a comprehensive level of performance measurement and attribution analysis in terms of quality of output, content and timeliness.

Department Overview

The BI-SAM Professional Services team is the authority for successful B-One product implementations worldwide. Our Professional Services Group is comprised of highly experienced and knowledgeable functional and technical consultants that specialize in the implementation of B-One. Utilizing the B-One Implementation Methodology, our Professional Services team works closely with our customers to understand their functional and technical requirements as well as their organizational processes in order to drive a successful system implementation. We encourage our colleagues to obtain professional certifications such as the CFA, CIPM, PRINCE2, PMP and similar technical certifications so as to advance their effectiveness and professional growth. We always operate as a team and take collective responsibility for the success of each implementation.

Job Opportunity

We are seeking Implementation Managers to lead our global system implementations. The Implementation Manager is responsible for multiple aspects of the project including the sign-off of customer requirements and delivery deadlines, communication with key stakeholders and internal management, management of internal and external project resources and managing the project budget and schedule. The ideal candidate will have extensive demonstrable Project Management experience gained in the financial industry working for a consultancy or software vendor. Experience leading the implementation of a Front, Middle or Back Office Asset Management system is highly valued. However, candidates with exceptional Project Management skills who have successfully led enterprise-level Capital Markets or other Financial IT projects will definitely be considered.

Responsibilities

• Utilize the B-One Implementation Methodology to successfully implement our solution. You will be responsible for tracking the progress of an implementation to meet deliverables and the system go-live date. You will also help to refine our Implementation Methodology and Best Practices so that we continue to provide the best possible implementation services to our customers.
• Manage internal and external resources involved in the project. This requires the ability to rally and lead a team comprised of BI-SAM professionals, customers and partners.
• Communicate with customers to review business, functional and technical requirements to ensure the highest quality delivery of the system implementation as well as any product enhancements.
• Collaborate with the Project Team to set and manage stakeholder expectations around project timelines and budget. You will be responsible for managing and communicating issues to the customer and internal project teams. You will also be the first level of escalation for all project issues.
• Organize a team with the required skills for a successful project while providing our team members with appropriate opportunities for professional growth. Contributing to the development of our Professional Services team is critical as we scale to meet our firm’s sales growth.

Qualifications and Skills

• 10-15 years Project Management experience leading the implementation of enterprise-scale technical solutions. Experience in the implementation of a financial system within a Bank, Hedge fund or Asset Manager is especially valuable.
• Project Management certification such as PMP or PRINCE2 and a strong knowledge of project management methodologies and tools as well as an ability to apply the appropriate techniques to the unique circumstances of each customer.
• Working in systems or business analysis and system design preferably within Asset Management or Financial Services.
• A strong record of customer service. The Implementation Manager will need to understand customer needs and build effective relationships. The IM must be able to convey plans, issues and concerns to clients and team members in a clear, logical and concise manner. They will need to also be able to influence key decision makers both internally and externally.
• Must be customer driven, have the ability to work within a team environment, and be focused on providing a high quality of service to the customer.
• Strong organizational and presentation skills. Candidate must be able to create and manage a complex project plan in an efficient and timely manner.
• Strong time management skills including the ability to manage multiple projects in parallel.
• Ability to think logically to solve complex problems.
• Effective verbal and written communication skills.
• Self-motivated, strong collaboration and team-building skills.
• Proven ability to work in cross-functional, geographically dispersed teams.
• Bachelor degree required
• Most work is conducted at client sites and BI-SAM’s office but occasional travel is required.

If you enjoy a fast paced work environment with opportunities for growth, development and success, then please send your resume and cover letter to job@bi-sam.com to be considered for this position.

To learn more about BI-SAM then please visit us at www.bi-sam.com.

BI-SAM is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

description:
A major international Bank located in Hoboken, NJ is seeking a Vice President, IT Risk & Information Security Manager to promote the control of the IT related risk management and information security risk related activities undertaken by the bank.


JOB FUNCTIONS/DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES


Establishes and enforces the IT System risk and Information security risk management governance methodology and framework.

Establishes and maintains the IT System risk management Policies, Standards and Procedures.

Establishes and maintains the Bank wide Security Standards, Information security related Policies, Standards, and Procedures.

Improves and promotes the IT System risk and Information security risk related activities.

Organizes, conducts and performs the Bank’s Information security risk assessment and gap analysis process.

Organizes and performs the IT System risk assessment and gap analysis for all assets, technologies, products and functions introduced to the Bank with in IT.

Establishes and monitors compliance with the information security requirement for System Development Life Cycle.

Monitors compliance with the Security Standards, Policies and Architecture.

Conducts the performance of annual mandatory information security awareness seminars to alert the Bank’s employees to the information security and best practices.

Prepares and/or coordinates Monthly/Quarterly Operations Risk Meeting and other related meetings.

Encourages group members and others to work in a team-oriented manner.

Enhances employee’s knowledge and understanding of job responsibilities through continuous communication and on the job training.  Training should focus on establishing high quality/accuracy of work.

Performs all other duties and responsibilities as assigned by management.


RISK MANAGEMENT


General Risk Management Responsibilities: Has good knowledge of applicable risk management practices required to create a culture of risk management compliance for his or her group or department. Identifies, assesses, and monitors applicable risks based on the Bank’s risk management policies and procedures. Reviews work of subordinates for risk management purposes, if applicable.

Exhibits best practice risk management skills through effective internal risk controls, risk monitoring, risk assessment and improvement of risk management processes.

Specific type of risks applicable to the job function such as credit risk, market risk, liquidity risk, operational risk, legal/compliance risk, reputational risk and information security risk shall be discussed with the manager and senior manager of the area.


REQUIREMENTS


Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Business, Economics, Finance, Law, I.T., Marketing, Accounting or equivalent.  MBA preferred.

More than ten years’ experience in the IT risk management and/or IT Audit related activities of the financial industry.  CISSP accreditation preferred.

Good oral and written skills on a business level in English.

Substantive and diverse knowledge of the Parent Bank and other Japanese financial organization’s business practices, products and procedures.

Good managerial skills relating to employees, planning and policy formulation.

Substantive and diverse knowledge of securities-related legal, tax, regulatory compliance and/or accounting treatment

Good interpersonal skills (especially in interacting with Japanese, U.S. customers and personnel, Parent Bank, etc.)

Good communication and leadership skills.
title: Vice President , IT Risk and Information Security Risk Manager

description:
Leadership position with global responsibility for leading the strategic sourcing function for the IT Professional Services category.


Picture yourself building a successful career at AIG Property Casualty working alongside other talented, highly motivated individuals committed to reaching our goal of becoming the #1 insurance provider and changing the way Americans think about, purchase and use insurance. We believe that our success depends on building a world class team. If you would like to be a part of our team, we invite you to consider putting your talents to work with AIG.

Position Summary:

Leadership position with global responsibility for leading the strategic sourcing function for the IT Professional Services category.

Organizational Structure:

This position reports to the VP of Professional Services Sourcing.

Performance Objectives:

(i) Building and maintaining a team of motivated, engaged and effective sourcing professionals supporting the AIG business and functions globally

(ii) Providing strategic leadership with respect to the development and execution of global sourcing strategies (both supply and demand) related to significant AIG spend ($500M-$800M)

(iii) Establishing and expanding relationships with AIG clients across business units and global functions, including senior management

(iv) Influencing strategies and decisions and leading complex, highly visible, negotiations with major vendors;

(v) Managing relationships with major vendors that support AIG globally

(vi) Participating in the leadership of Global Sourcing & Procurement Services (GS&PS) across spend categories and functions so as to contribute to the achievement of GS&PS objectives both with respect to this position's direct responsibility as well as GS&PS objectives across categories and functions

(vii) Providing leadership in a manner that contributes to a culture built on principles of innovation, collaboration, client focus, continuous improvement and empowerment

The Ideal Candidate Should Have:

- Minimum of 10 years experience in leadership positions within a global sourcing or related function.

- Significant experience developing and executing global category strategies and leading a team of sourcing professionals responsible for the strategic sourcing function globally as well as reviewing, analyzing and negotiating contract terms.

- Experience providing leadership in an environment of change with a focus on innovation, collaboration, client focus, continuous improvement and empowerment.

- Strong packaging and presentation skills with the ability to analyze and explain pricing models and contract terms.

- Strong understanding of legal concepts as related to contract negotiations.

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills and strong interpersonal skills.

- Excellent relationship management skills, as well as the ability to work collaboratively with senior management.

- Juris doctor, certified purchasing manager, masters degree in procurement/supply chain, business or related field, or equivalent experience.

About AIG
American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a leading international insurance organization serving customers in more than 130 countries and jurisdictions. AIG companies serve commercial, institutional, and individual customers through one of the most extensive worldwide property-casualty networks of any insurer. In addition, AIG companies are leading providers of life insurance and retirement services in the United States.
AIG Property Casualty
is a global market leader, one of the few truly global property casualty franchises.

is one of the largest life insurance organizations in the U.S., and provides protection, investment and income solutions needed for financial and retirement security.
United Guaranty Corporation
is the marketplace leader in mortgage insurance in the U.S.

description:
BNP Paribas Investment Partners (BNPP IP) is one of the largest asset management firms in the world.


BNPP IP offers a diverse range of investment management strategies to institutional clients in the U.S. through our affiliates, including BNP Paribas Asset Management and Fischer Francis Trees & Watts.
Our clients include central banks, official institutions, corporations, pension plans, insurance companies, foundations, endowments, and mutual funds.  In the U.S. we have offices in Boston, Chicago, New Jersey and New York.  We have an excellent opportunity for a Credit Analyst in our New York office. Individual will provide credit opinions while working closely with senior colleagues as part of the Global Loans Team in New York and Paris.  The appropriate candidate for this position will be interested in developing a career in fixed income investment management.

Specific Responsibilities:


Responsible for fundamental research analysis on issuers in the US Leveraged Loans space.

Compose full credit write-ups for new transactions.

Undertake ongoing critical monitoring of portfolio positions, including changes in views using published company and industry information and correspondence with corporate issuers, sell side analysts and rating agencies.

Generate investment ideas and advise on timing for positions based on fundamental events and /or news flow.

Maintain industry opinions and produce periodic reviews.


Ideal Personal Profile:


Analytical Skills: Identifies all aspects of a subject and examines them in a critical way to construct a broad point of view. Is driven by the desire to know more about things, people or events.

Ability to summarize: Identifies and presents key information. Gives his /her point of view by structuring and summing up all useful elements. Shows the ability to put things in perspective.

Results Driven: Seeks to achieve the objectives set within the defined timeframe, by acting with tenacity and by balancing costs and benefits. Continuously seeks optimum performance.

Teamwork: Knows how to work in a team and /or across teams, acts bearing common interests and respect for fellow team members in mind.

Communication Skills: Expresses his / her messages, both orally and in writing, in an effective, organized way, which is appropriate to the audience being addressed.


Academic Background and Experience:


Minimum of ten years of credit analysis experience.

In-depth understanding of fundamental credit analysis, including ability to research industry sectors, competitive position, financial statements and financial notes. Strong credit analysis skills particularly in company financial statement analysis.

Familiarity with modeling cyclical sectors through cycles. Experience should include intensive analysis of company financial reporting such as annual reports, 10K, 8K, 20F and quarterly/semiannual financial reports.

Must be comfortable with mathematical concepts and financial modeling, as well as accounting rules and procedures. Strong quantitative skills.

Advanced computer skills (Excel, PowerPoint and Word).

A Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance, Accounting or a related discipline.

CFA Charter holder preferred.


Should you feel that your personal profile fits the desired criteria, we would welcome you to submit your resume as an application for review.
title: Credit Analyst

description:

SENIOR EVENT-DRIVEN OPTION PM - TOP-TIER HF
Employer:          Top-tier HF
Location:            Chicago
Hire:                   Senior option & event-driven prop trader
Compensation:  Commensurate
IJC Reference:  #15087 (Please indicate this reference in communication)

Our Client

Our client is one of the world’s most prestigious HFs, with a dozen offices around the world, many strategies, covering all asset classes and managing a siginificant AUM.

The Option & Market-Making arm, which trades 3,500 different underlyings, is opening a new proprietary trading group using derivatives over corporate events.

The Role

Our client is looking for the senior individual, who will build and lead this new group – define the approach, assemble a team, improve systems, manage the risks and generate significant P&Ls. This is a senior position.

The role will encompass:
• Define the rules of engagements: targets and strategy, approaches, risk limits…
• Lead: recruit, manage and grow the team’s human potential
• Generate profits with options on world/economic events, corporate actions, M&A activity, court rulings, forward price dislocations, through relative value and fundamental investing… The approach will be volatilist – no directional position on events/spinoffs but for hedging.

• Help the option market-making group recognize and analyze potential opportunities or risks, and leverage their market access to build prop positions

• Manage risks
• Improve the existing infrastructure, as needed
• Successfully integrate the new team among other option and market-making groups.

The Successful Candidate

Our client is top firm. It deserves an athlete. The successful candidate will
• excel in option trading, required
• excel in event-driven trading, required
• have a solid experience of the US markets, required
• having already lead an event-driven option trading group, at a HF or a top-tier B/D strongly preferred
• have a proven TR of building successful proprietary trading businesses, required
• possess strong management and people skills, team & collegial culture, required
• have achieved the solid academia necessary to understand the technicalities of the trades, risks and systems, required. Ivy League education, advanced degrees… preferred.
• US visa/working permit, preferred.

The Offer

Besides a solid compensation and career growth, the client will help you with relocation and/or visa, if needed.

To apply to this role or obtain further information, please contact Gontran de Quillacq, Managing Director, Head of Quantitative & Risk Practice. W: +1 (646) 710-3457, Gontran@IJCPartners.com, www.linkedin.com/in/gdequillacq

description:
Milestone Aviation Group (Milestone) is seeking a Vice President of Oil & Gas Strategy - Helicopter to lead our strategic marketing efforts in the Oil and Gas (O&G) sector. The position will report to the Senior Vice President of Strategy and Corporate Development.


Essential Responsibilities

·  Lead development of Milestone Oil & Gas helicopter demand forecast.

·  Identify third party data sources and develop bottom up forecast of production platforms and exploration and development rigs by location.

·  Work with commercial team and operator partners to develop assumptions around helicopter operations by region (standard crew change schedule, avg pax per trip, non-crew change trips, etc).

·  Partner with AVP of Fleet Analytics to compare supply versus demand in O&G sector going forward.

·  Develop point of view to inform senior management on firm order commitments and option positions based on resulting demand model for new helicopters in O&G segment.

·  Track oil company activity and helicopter transportation services tenders.

·  Partner with commercial team in developing relationships with aviation, logistics and procurement groups at oil companies.

·  Collect and forecast tender activity from oil companies, operators, and commercial team. Track tender activity by region.

·  Develop point of view on trends in Oil and Gas helicopter transportation market to inform decision making and approval process.

·  Provide insight into current down-turn in oil price and expected timing of recovery.

·  Deepen Milestone’s knowledge of oil and gas sector and market drivers.

·  Track information provided by operators and oil companies to determine stakeholder assumptions.

·  Build relationships with OEM analytics teams to understand assumptions behind OEM build forecasts.

·  Supply key data points to approval papers, business updates, and corporate communications.


Qualifications/Requirements

Basic Qualifications:

·  10 years’ experience in Oil &Gas market analytics

·  Self-starter - able to develop resources, assumptions and build forecast with little guidance

·  Extensive knowledge of offshore oil and gas market

·  Expert on modeling and data analytics

·  Willingness to learn positioning and capabilities of key commercial helicopter types

·  Ability to develop and maintain influential relationships with commercial team



Eligibility Requirements:

·  MUST be able to satisfy the requirements of Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.

·  MUST submit application for employment through COS (internal candidates) or www.gecareers.com (external candidates) to be considered for this position.

·  MUST be at least 18 years of age.

·  MUST be willing to comply with pre-employment screening, including but not limited to, drug testing and background check.

·  MUST be willing to travel occasionally to meet the needs of the business.

·  MUST be willing to work out of an office in Columbus, OH; Houston, TX; Dublin Ireland or London UK office.


Legal authorization to work in the United States is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job opening.

Additional Eligibility Qualifications

GE will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation and drug screen.

Desired Characteristics

·  MBA degree

·  Leading consulting firm experience preferred

description:
Independent Energy Trading firm, growing a new Global LNG desk are hiring for entrepreneurial and ambitious Senior LNG Traders to be based in each of their Global offices – London (x1), Houston (x2), Singapore (x1) and Dubai (x1).


My client are an independent energy trading firm, who are going through aggressive growth through opening new Global offices and also diversifying into new energy products, including LNG trading.  Currently they do not have an LNG trading desk as such, but have done a lot of work on business development, including signing Master agreements with several producers and end users as well.  They are looking for experienced LNG Traders with excellent knowledge of LNG trading process (buy/sell), creating desks, putting all data together – good people with good relationships with producers, consumers etc.  They do not have production themselves, so are looking for LNG Traders who are executors who do the actual business development and trading.  In short, they need to hire autonomous LNG Traders who can build the business from scratch, giving them access to the markets where they operate (network).



Due to their growth in LNG, they will be looking to promote a Global Head of LNG from within, so this is a great opportunity for an ambitious Senior LNG Trader to join and quickly take a step up in responsibility.



Salary: Open depending on the level of the individual and location + sign-on or guaranteed bonus and/or annual bonus + benefits.  These are senior roles though so need LNG Traders with deep LNG Trading expertise and networks with the salaries and total remuneration reflecting this.



For more information, please e-mail through an up-to-date copy of your CV to David at d.smith@bramwithconsulting.co.uk

description:
Senior Program Manager, Finance Data Transition


Senior Program Manager



PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE POSITION

The Senior Program Manager, Finance Data Transition,  is responsible for the management and execution of the transition of critical fund accounting services, encompassing multiple initiatives that span people, process and technology required for successful implementation.

The Finance Data transition will involve critical components of fund accounting capability,  core of our firm’s business model. Without fund accounting capability, the firm is unable to operate in compliance, management and recordkeeping for data supporting hundreds of billions of dollars in assets under management (currently $750 billion). The Program Manager, partners with the new service providers program manager to successfully execute projects and initiatives encompassing referential, transactional, and analytical systems, associates, and processes supporting fund accounting —and by extension, the enterprise.



The incumbent indirectly manages a team of program and project managers, as well as analysts and associates in varying roles across the organization to deliver on the full scope of business change projects included within this program.  This position is responsible for ensuring the program is executed to deliver on the strategic goals and objectives of the program and in partnership with the business sponsor, realize desired business value for the firm.  The incumbent will drive overall change planning and alignment to business goals through the development of portfolio and program management strategy, governance, resource planning and stakeholder management.



PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES

Leads the team of Program and Project Managers to effectively execute the transition program and all projects included in the scope.  Responsible for planning and strategizing across the program in order to identify resources needed, financial impacts, project interdependencies, and future state strategy planning.  Provides direction and guidance to program and project managers to ensure successful planning and execution of the initiative.  Partners with the lead team to drive the overall program strategy and execution and governance plan.



In conjunction with the business sponsors and stakeholders, develops the strategy for managing the program timeline and budget consisting of multiple, concurrent projects with multiple deliverables and components across a multi-year period.  Proactively works with the sponsor to identify, approve, and prioritize all projects and deliverables throughout the lifecycle of the program.   Develops the program schedule consisting of the components, the order in which they must be executed, the amount of time required for each, and the major program level milestones.  Also responsible for estimation, approval, and management of the program budget.   They must pinpoint the funds available for each of the deliverables, present them to sponsors for approval, and monitor and manage those funds against the program plan.



Defines the governance goals, structure, roles, and responsibilities for the program portfolio.  Including plans for portfolio audits, governance, prioritization and oversight, and control program change management.  Through structured governance, ensures planning, scheduling, executing, monitoring, and controlling projects within the program to achieve strategic goals and objectives.   Ensures alignment with EPMO standards, and consistency in execution and organization of projects within the program by the project managers and their teams.  Provides the framework for managing related projects considering key factors such as strategic benefits, coordinated planning, complex interdependencies, deliverable integration, constraints, and optimized pacing.



Works with program/project managers to provide timely and accurate program information to all stakeholders (senior management, sponsors, stakeholders, and program team).  Determines the communication needs and ensures information is provided in a timely manner.  Effectively manages expectations and clearly, concisely, and consistently communicates the strategy, goals, and objectives of the program.  Facilitates program status meetings with the project managers and provides status to the sponsor group on an agreed upon frequency.



QUALIFICATIONS


10+ years in the
Financial Investments
Industry

10+ years of solutions development work experience including managing projects

10+ years of
Program Management
experience

PMP Certification

MBA preferred (BS or BA Degree minimum)

PgMP Certification

Project Server experience

SharePoint and MS Project experience

Extensive knowledge of PMBOK



Experience managing a team of 2-4 project managers/project leads and large matrix teams

Outstanding client relationship management skills

Strong negotiation and influencing skills

Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Experience managing budgets exceeding $20M+

Ability to translate technical concepts into non-technical terms

Ability to work well with people with varying technical, business, and cultural backgrounds

Comfortable working with executive management

description:
This function will suit a strategy orientated Director level Business Manager or COO with operational awareness and a dual ability to manage the relationship with regulators. Based in NY only suitable for someone domiciled in NY


~~Director - Regional Senior Business Manager, Americas
The Head of Client Management role is to facilitate and own the delivery of the entire divisional service proposition across new business, due diligence and data management on behalf of the business.  The role is intended to operate with a strong commercial focus ensuring tight alignment to the objectives of the business, whilst enabling the right service delivery, at the right time, for the right price
The Regional Business Manager will act a Deputy to the Head of Americas (for this division).
The job holder will work closely with the Global Management Team, Site Heads, Service Management functions, Finance & Risk and Change Management functions.
Critical external interfaces are with stakeholders, Global Banking and Markets COO communities, Risk and Human Resources

**The skills gap within the group is strong operational team leadership.  Someone that has a profile of successfully managing people within Capital Markets Operations at the senior VP to Junior Director level and to take a lot of the slack from the Head of Americas (for this division).  The profiles of those in the department are very closley matched with no natureal successor being seen at this moment, hence the need for an ability to lead a group from a personell and operational management perspective**

Principal Accountabilities include:
Strategy
• Driving and coordinating strategies (including location) and objectives on behalf of the Regional Head and oversee the delivery of objectives working closely with the Global Management Team.

Planning
• Own and drive the yearly strategic planning process ensuring alignment of  onboarding functions with business needs
• Own and drive the on-going management activity that supports the day to day running of the function (e.g. management meetings, quarterly reviews, expense updates, Town Hall planning etc.)
• Work closely with the divisional Portfolio Manager to ensure the change portfolio is tightly aligned to the business strategy and plans
• Monitor actual / projected expense levels versus budgets & explain major variances ;
• Manage expense control procedures, identifying and implementing cost savings and administrative/internal controls;
• Define and implement financial reporting measures
• Drive a culture of continuous improvement to encourage reduction of the expense ratios across units

Risk Management
• Manage the operational risk framework for the group, i.e. leading activity and ensuring issues and mitigating actions are duly escalated and tracked till completion.

People Management
• Manage headcount and oversee People Management activities, e.g. The Talent pool; Overall Resource footprints, Succession Planning and Global People Survey actions.
Marketing & Communications
• Manage communications with employees
• Assist the Regional Head of with stakeholder communications, e.g. Presentations

Transformation and Special Projects
• Own specific projects on behalf of the Regional Head, including for example, client service focused initiatives, quality improvement benchmarking, efficiency programs so that economies of scale and the benefits of consistency are realised.
• Drive the implementation of cross-functional operational risk and audit actions.
• Lead streamlining / business process re-engineering initiatives
• Lead the expansion into new countries in the region

description:
Support the Head of Corporate Banking China Group in developing the Mergers and Acquisitions Advisory Business for the New York Branch.



Primary Responsibilities:


A.Support the Head of Corporate Banking China Group in developing the Mergers and Acquisitions Advisory Business for the New York Branch.

B.Solicit M&A business at the executive level. Identify target customers for the Branch. Develop and maintain relationships with corporate clients\sponsors\ financial institutions, including relationships with other branches and subsidiaries of CMB. Work closely with the Head Office.

C.Ability to structure and execute complex cross border transactions. Familiarity with cross tax border issues.

D.Develop local and international business solutions for clients including deal terms and structures.

E.Collaborate with clients’ legal and accounting advisors.

F.Oversee transactions from origination to closing including: valuation analysis, financial modeling, due diligence, preparing marketing materials, identifying, contacting, and negotiating with potential buyers and sellers.

G.Supervise junior staff in the preparation of approval memoranda, client presentations, marketing materials, and all materials necessary for the pitch process.




Additional Responsibilities:


A.Attend annual BSA/AML training program; assume responsibility, as appropriate, to report suspicious activity to BSA/AML Officer.


Qualifications Required:


A.Bachelor’s degree in Finance or Economics; M.B.A. preferred.

B.Minimum of twenty years of mergers and acquisitions advisory experience at a bulge bracket or reputable boutique investment bank.

C.Direct access to CEOs, and senior contacts at private equity, accounting and law firms.

D.Experience managing a deal team and proven track record in M&A advisory execution.

E.Demonstrated experience in managing of day to day aspects of client relationships and projects.

F.Strong collaboration and personal leadership skills with the ability to influence others.

G.Strong organizational, analytical, modeling, written and communication skills. Strong attention to detail.

H.Strong computer skills are essential.  Proficient in MS Office (Work, Excel and PowerPoint).

I.Flexibility, adaptability and team approach.

J.Willingness to take initiative.

K.Willingness to travel.

L.Strong integrity.

M.No relocation provided. Only candidates with direct experience will be considered. Please do not submit your resume if you do not meet the qualifications.

N.Bilingual (English and Mandarin) written and oral communication skills are preferred but not required.



Company Overview



China Merchants Bank (“CMB”) was founded in 1987 with its Head Office located in Shenzhen, China.  In over 28 years since its inception, China Merchants Bank has grown from a small bank with one office in Shenzhen to become China’s sixth-largest bank with more than 600 offices in 40 cities.  CMB was recognized as the most reputable and best-managed bank in China, winning numerous industry awards and honors for business performance, management capability and corporate culture.
Forbes
recently ranked CMB number 24 of the top 200 “World’s Most Reputable Companies”.

As the first Chinese bank to receive a banking license in the United States since the implementation of the Foreign Bank Supervision Enhancement Act of 1991, the CMB New York Branch secures a position as the bridge between clients in China and the United States.  The New York Branch, which commenced business operations in the Fall of 2008, establishes a global presence for China Merchants Bank.

This exciting position at the New York Branch will report to the Head of Corporate Banking – China Group.





This position offers an opportunity for professional growth within the Bank. Successful applicants will be asked to show proof that they can legally work in the U.S. without requiring visa sponsorship.

Please submit your
resume and cover letter to
MarketingCareers@ny.cmbchina.com
.
